quotes.t: She was certainly far from understanding him completely; his meaning was not at all times obvious. It was hard to see what he meant for instance by speaking of his provincial side—which was exactly the side she would have taken him most to lack. Was it a harmless {qword}paradox{/qword}, intended to puzzle her? or was it the last refinement of high culture?

Mr. Guppy propounds for Mr. Smallweed's consideration the {qword}paradox{/qword} that the more you drink the thirstier you are and reclines his head upon the window-sill in a state of hopeless languor.
For the actors, the goal was a {qword}paradox{/qword}: real emotion, produced on cue.

Again and again, he returns in his writing to the {qword}paradox{/qword} of a woman who is superior to the men around her by virtue of social class though considered inferior to them on account of her gender.
